newsitem.title: USA: Standard Motor sees no inventory drop soon.
newsitem.headline: Standard Motor sees no inventory drop soon.

text.p: Standard Motor Products Inc said Tuesday that while it is taking actions to reduce inventory, no significant reductions are expected for the rest of the year.

A statement from Standard Motor Products said it remains dissatisfied with its performance in asset management, primarily in the area of inventories, which at the end of the quarter were $9 million higher than a year ago, excluding inventories from acquisitions, the company said.
This increase, coupled with higher receivables and the finding of its acquisitions drove debt and interest expense higher for the quarter, the company said.
Interest expense increased by $1.2 million for the quarter, compared with a year ago, the company said.

"This area remains a key focus for management and specific actions are being implemented to reduce inventory, but we do not expect significant reductions the remainder of this year," the company statement said.
